abstract: Mack Breed, former assistant football coach accused of directing two players at John Jay High School in San Antonio to hit referee, pleads guilty to assault; is sentenced to 18 months of probation, fined $1,500 and ordered to serve 120 hours of community service and pay restitution.
lead_paragraph: Mack Breed, a former assistant football coach at John Jay High School in San Antonio, was sentenced to 18 months of probation. He was accused of directing two of his players to hit a referee.

headline.main: Assistant High School Coach in Texas Is Sentenced
headline.print_headline: Sports Briefing | High School Sports; Texas Coach Sentenced

snippet: Mack Breed, a former assistant football coach at John Jay High School in San Antonio, was sentenced to 18 months of probation. He was accused of directing two of his players to hit a referee.
